column4: Any idea how to extract the necessary files for ndiswrapper when the NetGear WN111 comes only with an EXE file?
unzip filename.exe
sure?
Yes
When run on Vista, it gives a full installer, ...
Extract the files.
After running that stupid installer, I got no INF file either, just a WN111.EXE ;(
unzip WN111.EXE
file WN111.EXE
I'm not on that box, but file did report a PE executable. When run on Vista it seemed to have no effect, perhaps because the USB device was not present on the Vista box.
Then you have the wrong file.
Try downloading drivers for XP system. or win98 system.
netgear is so nice to offer no drivers for download for that stick ;)
Is this a PCI device?
USB stick.
Oh, well, I don't know about those things.... May not be able to get it to work.
Is this a laptop?
Officially only supported on Vista.
nope, a desktop box.
Get a PCI card.  Or an ethernet bridge.
that costs money. That's a "Vista-upgrader" that is frustrated by Vista. So telling him to replace half his hardware is a no-go ;(
And I have already an "Unsupported" on his nice Scanner, which is not nice ;(
